sentence.text: Polymorphisms in the genes encoding carbamoyl-phosphate synthase 1 (steroid biosynthetic process) and N-acetylglutamate synthase (arginine biosynthetic process) were recently reported to be risk factors for the development of hyperammonemia during valproic acid-based therapy.

This study aimed to examine the influence of patient characteristics, including polymorphisms in steroid biosynthetic process 4217CAAAAA and arginine biosynthetic process -3064CAAAAA, on the development of hyperammonemia in Japanese pediatric epilepsy patients.
With regard to the steroid biosynthetic process 4217CAAAAA polymorphism, we did not observe a significant association with the development of hyperammonemia.
In conclusion, steroid biosynthetic process 4217CAAAAA polymorphism may not be associated with the development of hyperammonemia in Japanese population
